actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Glenn without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 123.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services Discharged.
Miss Collins (MI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Burton objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 420 - 3 (Roll no. 440).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 103-97.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service
committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services

official_title: A bill to redesignate the Pulaski Post Office located at 111 West College Street in Pulaski, Tennessee, as the "Ross Bass Post Office".

summary.text: Designates the building in Pulaski, Tennessee, that houses the primary operations of the United States Postal Service as the Ross Bass Post Office Building.

titles.title: A bill to redesignate the Pulaski Post Office located at 111 West College Street in Pulaski, Tennessee, as the "Ross Bass Post Office".
